summary: This is the last will and testament of Jeffrey E. Epstein, signed and notarized on November 18, 2014. It bequeaths his entire estate to the trustees of The Jeffrey E. Epstein 2014 Trust and appoints Darren K. Indyke, David Mitchell, and James E. Staley as executors, with Lawrence H. Summers as a successor executor.

locations: Little St. James Island, St. Thomas, United States Virgin Islands
Territory of the United States Virgin Islands, Division of St. Thomas and St. John
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein's will, dated November 18, 2014, leaves his entire estate to the trustees of 'The Jeffrey E. Epstein 2014 Trust'.
The primary executors appointed are Darren K. Indyke, David Mitchell, and James E. Staley, with Lawrence H. Summers named as a successor executor.
Each executor is to be paid $250,000 upon completion of probate, with no other compensation for serving.
The will includes a 'no-contest' clause, disinheriting any beneficiary who challenges the will or the trust.
The document shows Epstein's domicile as Little St. James Island in the U.S. Virgin Islands at the time the will was made.
